DGACM.relevance_comment: Rule 6 directs that the President shall, through the Secretary-General, notify Members and other authorities of session opening dates. This creates an obligation on the Secretariat to issue official notifications — a task implemented by DGACM in its conference-management and meetings-planning functions (see PPB: conference management, planning/coordination of conference services; Protocol and Liaison Service activities).

Rule 9(1) requires the Secretary-General to draw up the provisional agenda for each session and submit it to the Council. Preparing and circulating provisional agendas and related documentation is a core secretariat function that DGACM performs (PPB: substantive and technical secretariat support to intergovernmental bodies; subprogramme 1 and conference-management activities).

Rule 10 instructs the Secretary-General to communicate the provisional agenda (after Council consideration) to Members, specialized agencies and others. DGACM implements agenda and meeting communications and dissemination (PPB: planning and coordination of conference services; use of e-deleGATE/eJournal to notify delegates).

Rule 11 requires that the provisional agenda for a special session be transmitted to the authorities listed in rule 10 at the same time as the notice convening the Council. This is an operational Secretariat task (issuing notices and agendas) that DGACM carries out under its conference-servicing and meeting-notification responsibilities.

Rule 12(2) states that supplementary items shall be placed by the Secretary-General on a supplementary list and communicated with supporting statements. That places a clear procedural duty on the Secretariat to compile and circulate supplementary agendas and documents — work done by DGACM (PPB: secretariat servicing, document management and communication platforms).

Rule 17 requires credentials and names of alternates/advisers to be submitted to the Secretary-General (and the Bureau to examine them). The registration/verification and handling of credentials and participant lists are tasks performed by DGACM's Protocol and Liaison Service and conference-management teams (PPB: paragraph 2.1(d) and Protocol and Liaison Service description).

Rule 28(1) provides that the Secretary-General shall act in that capacity at Council meetings and may designate a member of the Secretariat as his representative. This establishes the Secretariat's presence and representation role at meetings — functions operationalized by DGACM staff who provide procedural and technical secretariat support (PPB: subprogramme 1 and conference management).

Rule 28(2) requires the Secretary-General to provide and direct the staff required by the Council and be responsible for all arrangements necessary for its meetings. That directs the Secretariat to mobilize staffing and logistical arrangements — core DGACM responsibilities (PPB: planning/coordination of conference services; meetings and publishing services).

Rule 28(3) requires the Secretary-General to keep members of the Council informed of questions to be brought before it. DGACM implements member communications, scheduling and information distribution for intergovernmental bodies (PPB: e-deleGATE, iGov, eJournal and other delegate-facing platforms).

Rule 29(a) mandates that the Secretariat shall interpret speeches made at meetings. This is a direct operational mandate for interpretation services that DGACM provides (PPB: subprogramme 4 – Meetings and publishing services; interpretation services across duty stations).

Rule 29(b) requires the Secretariat to receive, translate and circulate documents. This directly maps to DGACM's documentation services (translation, editing, circulation) as described in subprogramme 3 of the PPB.

Rule 29(c) mandates that the Secretariat print, publish and circulate the records of the sessions, the resolutions of the Council and required documentation. DGACM's publishing and distribution activities (subprogramme 4 and publishing-related deliverables) implement this requirement.

Rule 29(d) gives the Secretariat custody of documents in the archives. DGACM is responsible for document management, archival custody and publication systems (PPB: documentation services and publishing operations).

Rule 29(e) requires the Secretariat to 'generally perform all other work that may be required.' This is a broad directive to the Secretariat to carry out ancillary meeting and documentation tasks — functions that DGACM carries out in delivering conference and document services across duty stations (PPB overall orientation and subprogrammes).

Rule 32 designates Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish as the official languages and English, French and Spanish as working languages of the Council. This establishes a multilingual requirement that DGACM operationalizes as the Secretariat-wide lead on multilingualism and through its language services (PPB: paragraph 2.1(c) and 2.3 on multilingualism coordination).

Rule 33(1) requires that speeches made in an official language shall be interpreted into the other official languages. This is an explicit mandate for interpretation services — central to DGACM's meetings and interpretation functions (subprogramme 4).

Rule 33(2) allows speeches in non-official languages provided the speaker supplies interpretation into an official language and permits Secretariat interpreters to base interpretation on that. This prescribes interpretation procedures that DGACM must support operationally (PPB: interpretation and meeting support responsibilities).

Rule 34 requires that records be drawn up in the working languages and that translations be furnished on request. This directs the Secretariat to produce multilingual records — a core DGACM documentation mandate (subprogramme 3: simultaneous issuance and translation services).

Rule 35 mandates that all resolutions and formal decisions of the Council shall be published in the official languages. DGACM's publishing and documentation services are tasked with ensuring simultaneous multilingual publication in line with this rule (PPB: simultaneous issuance mandates and publishing subprogramme).

Rule 37 requires sound recordings of meetings to be made and kept by the Secretariat. DGACM operationally provides verbatim reporting, audio recording, transcription and related meeting-record services (PPB: meetings and publishing services; verbatim reporting/transcription targets).

Rule 38(1–2) mandates that the Secretariat prepare and distribute summary records of public meetings in the working languages, allow corrections, and distribute final records. DGACM undertakes preparation, editing, translation and dissemination of summary and verbatim records (PPB: documentation services and subprogramme deliverables).

Rule 40 requires that the text of resolutions and other formal decisions be distributed as soon as possible to members and participants and that printed texts be distributed after the session. DGACM's publishing, printing and distribution functions implement these obligations (PPB: subprogramme 4 publishing services; simultaneous issuance responsibilities).
